name: Play
purpose: Make mezcal learning feel like a game: social energy, friendly chaos, laughter, hands in motion, cards in use. The cards spark banter, decisions, dares, and ‘one more round’ momentum.
what_this_pillar_is: Game-night energy where the cards are used, not displayed.
Hands-on interactions: shuffling, dealing, fanning, choosing, passing cards.
Social context: friends clustered at a table, casual bar rituals, lived-in surfaces.
Playful decision-making: which mezcal next, which agave wins, friendly debate.
what_this_pillar_is_not: Quiet macro agave study (that is Discover).
Instructional how-to optimisation (that is Level Up).
Stiff posed lifestyle shoot or glossy ad perfection.

content_goals.brand_goal: Position the cards as the ultimate mezcal icebreaker: the thing you bring out that instantly makes the night better.
content_goals.audience_goal: Make people want to pick up the deck and start playing right now.
content_goals.content_goal: High-repeat, scroll-stopping ‘I can hear this photo’ moments.

visual_story_rules.core_rule: Every Play image must show cards being actively used in a real moment.
hook_types_ranked: card fan held up during laughter
a tiny accident (spilled salt, knocked coaster, lemon wedge sliding)
split-second choice moment (card hovering above table)
composition_bias: product readable but not perfectly staged

intensity_bands.label: calm warm-up
intensity_bands.play_behaviour: gentle interaction, tidy table, minimal motion

intensity_bands.label: social-ready
intensity_bands.play_behaviour: hands active, one clear action moment, controlled clutter

intensity_bands.label: kinetic table energy
intensity_bands.play_behaviour: mid-action moments, motion implied, still readable hero card

intensity_bands.label: friendly chaos (controlled)
intensity_bands.play_behaviour: maximum energy without losing clarity, chaotic-but-readable spread

sub_modes.name: Quick draw
sub_modes.intent: A split-second decision moment where someone commits to a card.
hook_patterns_still: a card hovering 2 cm above the table, decision tension
one sharp card edge, everything else mid-motion
hook_patterns_video: first frame: card hover decision, then hand slaps it down
first frame: frozen tension, then fast commit movement
moment_templates_still: A hand holds one card just above the table, mid-choice, with the deck scattered casually.
A single card is halfway slid forward like a challenge being accepted.
moment_templates_video: First frame: card hover decision is crisp and readable. After frame 1: the hand slaps the card down gently, no chaos spill.
First frame: card is mid-slide. After frame 1: it completes the slide and stops cleanly.

sub_modes.name: Tabletop challenge
sub_modes.intent: Cards create a mini competition: compare, vote, argue, choose the next pour.
hook_patterns_still: foreground card face sharp, background laughter blurred
hook_patterns_video: first frame: spread is readable, then hands rearrange one card into a ‘winner’ position
first frame: stable spread, then a glass toast happens in background
moment_templates_still: A casual spread of 4 to 6 cards anchors the scene while hands point and debate.
One card is clearly the focus while others sit in soft blur like options.
moment_templates_video: First frame: tabletop spread is crisp. After frame 1: a hand nudges the ‘winning’ card forward by 1 cm.
First frame: spread is stable. After frame 1: someone taps a card twice like a vote.

sub_modes.name: Happy accident
sub_modes.intent: A tiny believable mishap creates comedy without slapstick.
hook_patterns_still: salt spill like a little crime scene
coaster knocked sideways, cards still readable
hook_patterns_video: first frame: accident frozen mid-action, then settles naturally
first frame: still, then a lime wedge rolls 3 cm
moment_templates_still: A tipped salt dish spills a small pile near the cards, while a hand reaches in to fix it.
A bottle is almost knocked (blank label), caught just in time, cards remain the anchor.
moment_templates_video: First frame: salt spill moment is crisp. After frame 1: the salt slides slightly then stops, hand stabilises the dish.
First frame: bottle near-miss is frozen. After frame 1: a hand catches it gently with no splash.

sub_modes.name: Hands on
sub_modes.intent: Pure tactile gameplay: shuffling, dealing, fanning, passing cards.
hook_patterns_still: mid-shuffle with one sharp card edge
motion blur surrounding a crisp card corner
hook_patterns_video: first frame: crisp card edge mid-shuffle, then full shuffle continues
first frame: fan begins, then expands smoothly
moment_templates_still: Hands mid-shuffle dominate the frame, rings and tattoos add texture, one card edge razor sharp.
A fan of cards flashes in warm light, the table clutter feels real not staged.
moment_templates_video: First frame: shuffle moment is crisp and readable. After frame 1: shuffle accelerates with motion blur on surrounding cards only.
First frame: fan is half-open. After frame 1: fan opens fully then snaps closed.

sub_modes.name: Games in wild places
sub_modes.intent: Adventure vibe without becoming postcard travel content. Still playable and intimate.
hook_patterns_still: cards sharp in foreground, landscape soft behind
wind and warm light make the scene feel alive
hook_patterns_video: first frame: foreground card crisp, then a breeze lifts a corner
first frame: still, then dust drift or light shift
moment_templates_still: A hand holds one card up at golden hour, table edge and copita barely visible.
Cards on a rough surface outdoors, with one corner lifted by wind.
moment_templates_video: First frame: card foreground is crisp. After frame 1: wind nudges a corner and it settles back.
First frame: still. After frame 1: a warm light shift sweeps across the table.

sub_modes.name: Games with friends
sub_modes.intent: Group laughter and debate with cards as the anchor object, not portrait content.
hook_patterns_still: foreground cards sharp, background laughter blurred
candid debate energy, not posed smiles
hook_patterns_video: first frame: cards crisp, then hands pass a card across the table
first frame: stable, then a toast happens behind the cards
moment_templates_still: Friends clustered around a worn table, one person fanning cards while others laugh out of focus.
Over-shoulder view: someone holds a card while the table layout hints at the round.
moment_templates_video: First frame: foreground cards are crisp. After frame 1: a hand passes a card into frame and someone laughs in the background.
First frame: stable scene. After frame 1: a soft toast motion happens behind the hero card.

from_marketing_plan.title: Games in Wild Places
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Playing the deck outdoors with adventure scenery behind.
scene_rules: Cards must still look true scale and believable outdoors
Avoid postcard-wide landscapes: keep it intimate and playable

from_marketing_plan.title: Bottle Knowledge
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: A playful ‘oops’ or interaction with mezcal props that sparks conversation.
critical_constraints: Mezcal bottles must have blank labels
Poured mezcal must be still, never bubbly
scene_rules: It should feel accidental, not staged slapstick
Cards remain the anchor object in-frame

from_marketing_plan.title: Hands On
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Full shuffles, deals, spreads. Pure tactile gameplay.
scene_rules: Faces optional but should be partial or blurred
Keep it casual and real, not casino tournament vibe

from_marketing_plan.title: Games With Friends
from_marketing_plan.one_liner: Friends laughing while the deck guides what to drink next.
scene_rules: No polished posing, no influencer smiles
Keep faces partial or candid, not portrait framing
Cards must stay readable and true scale

allowed_primary_subjects: single card in action (hovering, being slid, tapped)
deck box (rare, only if incidental on table edge)
best_fit_for_play: cards + mezcal glass in active moment
avoid_in_play: static upright hero card like a museum exhibit
macro agave-only textures (that belongs in Discover)
scale_locks: Playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches.
Cards must fit fully inside one adult hand.
No oversized cards, no warped edges.

people_and_framing.primary_rule: Play is social. Humans matter, but the shot still is not a portrait.

pillar_preference_ranked.notes: Best default. Rings, tattoos, sleeves, motion.
Background faces allowed but shallow DOF blur.

face_policy.rule: Avoid full portrait faces. Prefer partial faces or background blur. Cards + hands stay hero.

hand_requirements_if_present: no warped fingers or fused joints
hands remain secondary, cards remain the hero
casting_notes: real people, lived-in faces, not models
tattoos, vests, rolled-up sleeves, rings, bartenders

preferred.label: Low-lit neighbourhood bar
preferred.notes: Worn timber tables, warm lamps, casual crowd energy.

preferred.label: Urban loft hangout
preferred.notes: Exposed brick, compact table, intimate lighting.

preferred.label: Backyard patio
preferred.notes: String lights, relaxed group clustering around a table.

preferred.label: Cabin table
preferred.notes: Timber grain, cosy, game-night ritual feel.

preferred.label: Outdoor adventure spot
preferred.notes: Cliffside / mountain vibe, but keep it tight and playable.

avoid: luxury cocktail bars that feel too polished

rules: Props must feel incidental and lived-in, not arranged.
Use 3 to 6 small details max to avoid clutter overload.
Avoid readable text on menus, notebooks, receipts.
mezcal_specific_constraints: Any mezcal bottles must have blank or unbranded labels only.
Poured mezcal must be still liquid, never bubbly or fizzy.

camera_angles_ranked.label: Handheld close
camera_angles_ranked.notes: Best for motion and real-life energy.

camera_angles_ranked.label: 45-degree
camera_angles_ranked.notes: Classic bar table framing, adds depth.

camera_angles_ranked.label: Top-down
camera_angles_ranked.notes: Only for active spreads, not static layouts.

lighting_ranked.label: Golden hour
lighting_ranked.notes: Best for outdoor play, cosy warmth.

camera_and_lighting_preferences.depth_of_field_rule: Freeze one sharp element (card edge, card face, glass rim) with surrounding blur to amplify motion and realism.

continuity_locks: same number of objects and hands
same surface texture and background materials
no new labels or text appearing
mezcal remains still and never bubbly

realness_micro_specs: subtle dust and micro scratches on table surfaces
fingerprints and smudges on glass and glossy varnish
condensation ring or faint wet mark under a glass
physically accurate glass refraction and liquid meniscus
clean contact shadows under card corners and glass base
crisp card edges and consistent border thickness
motion implied by blur around a single sharp focal element
brand_hard_constraints: mezcal bottle labels must be blank
poured mezcal must never be bubbly or foamy
playing cards must be accurate size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches
no text, no logos, no watermarks, no UI icons
avoid warped hands and extra fingers
negatives: no bubbles or foam in mezcal

safe_commercial.notes: Clean and high hit-rate. Action feels believable and readable.

risky_chaotic.notes: Controlled chaos. More motion and tiny accidents, still must remain readable.

ultra_minimal_hero.notes: Minimal but still Play: one action cue only, no clutter.

hard_constraints_locked: no text overlays, no captions, no watermarks, no logos, no UI icons
no pristine studio staging, no sterile white backgrounds
no warped hands, no extra fingers
mezcal bottles must have blank or unbranded labels only
poured mezcal must be still liquid, never bubbly or fizzy
no readable text anywhere in the scene except on the reference card itself; all other writing must be blurred or illegible
playing cards must be true-to-size 2.5 inches by 3.5 inches, fit fully in one adult hand, never oversized

avoid_visuals: static upright card like a museum piece
full face portraits centred as the hero

good_output_signals: you can feel motion happening right now
hands and cards dominate the frame
faces are secondary or cropped, candid not posed
warm low light and lived-in table texture
cards look true scale and not warped
bad_output_signals: feels posed or staged like an ad
too many props creating clutter soup
bottle labels appear branded or readable
